fields.Title: Unitary Business
fields.Description/Abstract:
Unitary Business (Topic # 1012), is part of an online database for tax practitioners called "Catalyst"  and is available on the Thomson Reuters Checkpoint  database. Topic #1012 is a state-by-state examination of each state's specific definition of a unitary business as it
applies to corporate taxpayers. The Due Process Clause of the 14th Amendment to the U.S.
Constitution limits the ability of states to tax the income of multistate corporations. A state may only tax an apportioned share of income earned by a unitary business with a sufficient connection to the state. A multistate corporation (or affiliated group of corporations) doing business in a state must determine
which of its operations are in the same unitary business as its in-state activities. Most of the guidance comes from U.S. Supreme Court opinions interpreting the Due Process Clause in the context of state corporate taxation. Topic #1012 reviews those opinions-which provide general, nationwide guidance-and then summarizes each state's specific definition of a unitary business through statutes,rulings, court opinions, or other authorities.
